A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: An inane plot device that surely won't be used again centers call backs to previous star war movies\, making a patchwork of nostalgia that goes nowhere. Mark Hamill gets what seems like an hour of screen time which is a great example of writers mindlessly following the \"show don't tell rule\"\, as his character frustratingly won't talk about the obvious thing he should be talking about. the movie ends where it starts\, shedding only minor characters who seem important only because they are played by famous actors\, Rei is still Rei\, Kylo is moody emo baddie Kylo\, and everyone else is as they were\, (well\, Rose is a great new addition). The movie ends where it starts\, rebels running from the Empire\, where the next movie will end and start\, and the next and the next and the next....
